cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 535 miles SSE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest to north-northwest toward the middle Texas coast, likely striking the Matagorda Bay/Port O’Connor–San Luis Pass area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from north of Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass; Storm Surge Watch from Port Mansfield to High Island
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast from Port Mansfield through High Island, extending into southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds possible early Friday, with a 23% chance of sustained 50-kt (hurricane-force) winds as the core approaches.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–6 ft of inundation possible along the open coast and bays from Port Mansfield to High Island, including Matagorda Bay and the Calhoun Port area.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches, isolated 20 inches, beginning as early as Friday morning and continuing through the weekend, producing significant freshwater flooding risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; possible prolonged inundation if the system stalls inland.
